ratings.comment: There is a lot of pre-class work in this class. Professor Kim is pretty good. Sometimes it seems like he is pretending to be excited. Kim is a fair grader and you will learn a lot in this class. Participation is weighted heavily, so be prepared to have to listen to your classmates waste your time with pointless comments.

Not sure what all these negative comments are about; Prof. Kim is a great instructor! His projects are challenging, and he expects a lot from his students, but he's a fantastic resource for any budding entrepreneurs-or if you're just curious about business, management, or human resources.

It's abundantly clear that the vast majority of professor kim's experience is in academia.  He teaches rediculous concepts that have no application in the real world and wastes too much time on them.  In addition, his expectations in terms of prep work for each class are beyond absurd.  Assigns too much busy work that provides no educational value.

Ridiculous prof. He is teaching subject material that most people could grasp by reading wikipedia for an hour or two rather than taking his class. Applies meaningless "theories" to "entrepreneurship". I guess he doesn't understand the difference between joke classes (which he teaches) and hard classes. Which ironically makes him a joke! Stay away

This professor is not that good. Some of his policies and expectations are rediculous, which made 25 ppl dropped his class after the first class. His assignments are not very clear, he is a boring guy, and not cool at all. I recommend you take MHR 422 with Phil Greenwood during the Spring. He doesn't get it that students have a life outsde of skool

434 is a great class to take with Kim. I also had him for 422, and I enjoyed both. You will read some very interesting books, and learn basic entrepreneurship principles. Don't be turned off by his somewhat carefree style outside of class.  Good class; take it with Kim.

Kim is a great lecturer for an entrepreneurship course. Applies theory to real world examples.Can be unclear at times with assignments, and his grading system is kind of ridiculous,but you should have no problem getting a good grade if you do the work.Classes are interesting,and attending lecture is the best part.You will learn a lot in this class.

Rude?  Arrogant?  Must be a different Phil Kim.  I really liked the class and Prof. Kim.  Plenty of work to do, but if you keep up with it you'll do just fine.  This is a great intro entrepreneurship course!
Excellent, a great professor and person.
Great Professor. Knows how to teach "entrepreneurship". Helpful if planning on starting your own business. Intelligent
He is not good.  He is always rude in class.
Super arrogant, generally couldn't stand him.
